action: I want to safely and automatically integrate data with external services (Accounting SaaS, CRM, Payment Services, etc.)
reason: To prevent manual data transcription errors and improve operational efficiency and data consistency
acceptance_criteria: External API integration permits only authenticated system-to-system communication.
Integration settings can only be changed by the Administrator role.
External API endpoint URLs are validated.
Only HTTPS communication is permitted.
TLS certificate verification is enabled.
API authentication methods (OAuth2 / API Key / JWT, etc.) are selectable.
API keys are stored in encrypted storage.
Plaintext API keys are never output to logs.
Access token expiration management is implemented.
An automatic token renewal function exists.
Timeout settings are applied to API calls.
Retry processing is performed when timeouts occur.
The maximum number of retries is configurable.
Retries use exponential backoff upon external API errors.
Integration processing is executed via an asynchronous queue.
There is an upper limit on concurrent executions.
Integration data is converted to JSON format.
Data mapping settings are possible from the management screen.
Invalid data formats are treated as integration failures.
Data conversion errors are recorded in logs.
Success logs for integration are stored.
Failure logs for integration are stored.
Logs include request_id, timestamp, and endpoint.
Personal information fields are masked in log outputs.
Integration data is saved within a DB transaction.
Uniqueness checks exist to prevent duplicate data registration.
Concurrent update conflicts are detected via optimistic locking.
Signature verification of API responses is possible.
Signature verification is performed upon receiving Webhooks.
Countermeasures against Webhook replay attacks are implemented.
Webhook received data is sanitized.
SQL injection countermeasures are implemented.
XSS countermeasures are applied.
Webhooks from unauthorized IP addresses can be rejected.
Rate limits for API calls are implemented.
Processing waits in the queue if the rate limit is exceeded.
Execution history for data synchronization is stored.
The number of processed items is recorded in the execution history.
The number of successful/failed items is included in the execution history.
A manual re-execution function exists.
Re-execution is managed under the same request_id.
Integration can be stopped and resumed.
Audit logs are stored when integration settings are changed.
Internal information is not returned externally during API errors.
API versioning is managed.
Backward compatibility for schema changes is considered.
Data integration processing is subject to SLA monitoring.
Alert notifications are sent upon SLA violations.
Response times of integration processes are measured.
Performance metrics are sent to the monitoring infrastructure.
A circuit breaker activates during failures.
Fallback processing is defined.
Settings can be updated upon external API specification changes.
Integration data is unified in UTF-8.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
